name: js/app.js
js/components/controller.js
Controller
description: Takes a model and view and acts as the controller between them.

params.name: model
params.description: The model instance

params.name: view
params.description: The view instance

name: addItem
description:
An event to fire whenever you want to add an item. Simply pass in the event
object and it'll handle the DOM insertion and saving of the new item.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the new todo to add

name: editItem
description: Triggers the item editing mode.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the todo to edite

name: editItemSave
description: Finishes the item editing mode successfully.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the save todo edite

params.name: title
params.description: Todo's title

name: editItemCancel
description: Cancels the item editing mode.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the todo to cancel the editing

name: removeItem
description:
By giving it an ID it'll find the DOM element matching that ID,
remove it from the DOM and also remove it from storage.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the item to remove from the DOM and storage.

name: removeCompletedItems
description: Will remove all completed items from the DOM and storage.

name: toggleComplete
description:
Give it an ID of a model and it will update the item
in storage based on the checkbox's state.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the element to complete or uncomplete

params.name: completed
params.description: To check the state of complete or not

params.name: silent
params.description: Prevent re-filtering the todo items

name: toggleAll
description:
Will toggle ALL checkboxes' on/off state and completeness of models
Just pass in the event object.

params.name: completed
params.description: State of the toggleAll checkbox

name: _updateCount
description:
Updates the pieces of the page which change depending on the remaining
number of todos.

name: _filter
description: Re-filters the todo items, based on the active route.

params.name: force
params.description: forces a re-painting of todo items.

name: _lastActiveRoute
description: Store a reference to the last active route, allowing us to add condition and not show the new active route if it's the same as the last active route.

name: _updateFilterState
description: Simply updates the filter nav's selected states.

name: _activeRoute
description: Store a reference to the active route, allowing us to re-filter todo items as they are marked complete or incomplete.

name: setView
description: Loads and initialises the view.

params.description: | 'active' | 'completed'

name: showAll
description:
An event to fire on load. Will get all items and display them in the
todo-list

name: showActive
description: Renders all active tasks

name: showCompleted
description: Renders all completed tasks

name: js/components/helpers.js
Helpers
description: Manage the events with the DOM through the methods defined

name: qs
description: Act as a querySelector event

params.name: selector
params.description: Represents the class selector to be reach

params.name: scope
params.description: Represente the scope on which to look for the DOM's class selector

name: qsa
description: Act as a querySelectorAll event

params.name: selector
params.description: Represents the element/class DOM selector to be reach

params.name: scope
params.description: Represente the scope on which to look for the DOM's class selector

name: $on
description: Build an event listener according to the arguments passed in

params.name: target
params.description: Represents the targeted HTML tag from the DOM

params.name: type
params.description: Represents the type of event

params.name: callback
params.description: Represent the callback function attach to this event

name: $delegate
description: Create an event listener on a target element

params.name: target
params.description: Represents the targeted HTML tag from the DOM

params.name: selector
params.description: Represents the element/class DOM selector to be reach

params.name: type
params.description: Represents the type of event

params.name: handler
params.description: Represent the callback function attach to this event

name: $parent
description: Reach the parent node of a given element

params.name: element
params.description: Represents the element HTML tag that has been clicked from the DOM

params.name: tagName
params.description: The tag name to be reach

return.description: Return the parentNode of a specific tag name (if exist).

name: js/components/model.js
Model
description: Creates a new Model instance and hooks up the storage.

params.name: storage
params.description: A reference to the client side storage class

name: create
description: Creates a new todo model.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the task

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to fire after the model is created

name: read
description:
Finds and returns a model in storage. If no query is given it'll simply
return everything. If you pass in a string or number it'll look that up as
the ID ofthe model to find. Lastly, you can pass it an object to match
against.

params.name: query
params.description: A query to match models against

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to fire after the model is found

return.description: Return an array of parsed todos.

name: update
description:
Updates a model by giving it an ID, data to update, and a callback to fire when
the update is complete.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the model to update

params.name: data
params.description: The properties to update and their new value

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to fire when the update is complete

name: remove
description: Removes a model from storage.

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the model to remove

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to fire when the removal is complete

name: removeAll
description: WARNING: Will remove ALL data from storage.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to fire when the storage is wiped.

name: getCount
description: Returns a count of all todos.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to fire with todos Object when the getCount function is finished

name: js/components/store.js
Store
description:
Creates a new client side storage object and will create an empty
collection if no collection already exists.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of our DB we want to use

params.name: callback
params.description:
Our fake DB uses callbacks because in
real life you probably would be making AJAX calls

name: find
description: Finds items based on a query given as a JS object

params.name: query
params.description: The query to match against (i.e. {foo: 'bar'})

params.name: callback
params.description:
The callback to fire when the query has
completed running

name: findAll
description: Will retrieve all data from the collection

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to fire upon retrieving data

name: save
description:
Will save the given data to the DB. If no item exists it will create a new
item, otherwise it'll simply update an existing item's properties

params.name: updateData
params.description: The data to save back into the DB

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to fire after saving

params.name: id
params.description: An optional param to enter an ID of an item to update

name: createId
description: Will create a unique id for the new created todo

params.name: todos
params.description: The todos array to iterate trough it and get a new unique id

return.description: Return an brand new and unique id

name: remove
description: Will remove an item from the Store based on its ID

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the item you want to remove

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to fire after saving

name: drop
description: Will drop all storage and start fresh

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to fire after dropping the data

name: js/components/template.js

params.name: chr
params.description: Represent the incompatible HTML sign define by the new RegExp

return.description: Return a string with the HTML equivalent writing of the incompatible sign

params.name: string
params.description: The string to check with RegExp

name: Template
description: Sets up defaults for all the Template methods such as a default template

name: show
description:
Creates an <li> HTML string and returns it for placement in your app.

NOTE: In real life you should be using a templating engine such as Mustache or Handlebars, however, this is a vanilla JS example.

params.name: data
params.description: The object containing keys you want to find in the template to replace.

name: itemCounter
description: Displays a counter of how many to dos are left to complete

params.name: activeTodos
params.description: The number of active todos.

name: clearCompletedButton
description: Updates the text within the "Clear completed" button

params.name: completedTodos
params.description: The number of completed todos.

name: js/components/todo.js
Todo
description: Create a Todo app object

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the todo app, which will be use as localStorage name to store datas

name: js/components/view.js
View
description:
View that abstracts away the browser's DOM completely.
It has two simple entry points:

  - bind(eventName, handler)
    Takes a todo application event and registers the handler
  - render(command, parameterObject)
    Renders the given command with the options

params.name: template
params.description: Represent the HTML template of a todo

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the todo to remove

params.name: completedCount
params.description: Number of completed todos

params.name: visible
params.description: Control the visibility of the "clear completed" button

params.name: currentPage
params.description: The name of the current page

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the todo to toggle status

params.name: completed
params.description: Indicate the todo state

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the todo to edit

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the todo to edit

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the todo that has been edited

params.name: title
params.description: The name of the todo that has been edited

params.name: viewCmd
params.description: The name of the command to reach (which equivalent to a viewCommands method)

params.name: parameter
params.description: Parameter to change for a todo or multiple todos

params.name: element
params.description: Represent the HTML tag of the targeted element

return.description: The id of the parent li element of the targeted HTML tag

params.name: handler
params.description: Callback function

params.name: handler
params.description: Callback function

params.name: event
params.description: Name of the event

params.name: handler
params.description: callback function

content:
# to-do list app

Have peace of mind by adding all your tasks to your **to-do list** (wherever you are or whatever device you use).

**to-do list** is a SPA (single page application) modeling a simple todo list allowing you to add and follow your day-to-day tasks :

Please **[try it out](https://mysite.com)**!!

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/screenshot_todos.png)

It has never been easier to add, modify, delete, filter your todos!
But if you need, check the **[tutorial](./manual/tutorial.html)** for more details!

Check the **[manual](./manual)** if you want to dive into code details for future evolution and maintenance.
name: ./README.md
./manual/overview.md
content:
# Overview

Have peace of mind by adding all your tasks to your **to-do list** (wherever you are or whatever device you use).

**to-do list** is a SPA (single page application) modeling a simple todo list allowing you to add and follow your day-to-day tasks :

Please [try it out](https://todos.mokokom.com/)!!

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/screenshot_todos.png)

Documentation:

1. Check the [tutorial](./tutorial.html) to see how the to-do list works.
1. Check the [application_architecture](./application_architecture.html) to understand the main elements that make up the application.
1. check the [benchmarking](./benchmarking.html)

name: ./manual/application_architecture.md
content:
# Application architecture

The overwall app is based on the [ModelViewController](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Model%E2%80%93view%E2%80%93controller) (MVC) software design pattern. The files interact with each other using the ES6 `export` / `import` modules.

### Application's structure diagram

![app file structure](/images/app_architecture/Todo_app_schema.png)

_Todo application MVC architecture_

### Application's files structure

![app file structure](/images/app_architecture/app_files_structure.png)

_Application's files structure_

`index.html` is the skeleton of the website homepage. It loads all scripts.

`app.js` launch the app by initializing the view.

`components` folder contain seven files. Each file represents a ES6 class module:

1.  `controllers.js` ([see documentation](/docs/class/js/components/controller.js~Controller.html))
2.  `helpers.js` ([see documentation](/docs/class/js/components/helpers.js~Helpers.html))
3.  `model.js` ([see documentation](/docs/class/js/components/model.js~Model.html))
4.  `store.js` ([see documentation](/docs/class/js/components/store.js~Store.html))
5.  `template.js` ([see documentation](/docs/class/js/components/template.js~Template.html))
6.  `todo.js` ([see documentation](/docs/class/js/components/todo.js~Todo.html))
7.  `view.js` ([see documentation](/docs/class/js/components/view.js~View.html))

name: ./manual/tutorial.md
content:
# Tutorial

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/todos_homepage.png)

### Add a todo

- write your todo

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/first_todo.png)

- press Enter or click somewhere in the page to add it to the list

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/first_todo_added.png)

### Modify a todo

- double click the todo you want to modify

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/todo_tobe_modify.png)

- make your change
- press Enter or click somewhere in the page to add it in the list

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/todo_modify.png)

### Delete a todo

- click on the red cross on todo's right side when hovering it

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/todo_tobe_delete.png)

### Toggle state

Toggle a todo or multiple todos state according on the initial state before clicking it

1. toggle state of a todo
   - click on the circle on the todo's left side.

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/todo_tobe_toggle.png)
![todos homepage](/images/tuto/todo_toggle.png)

2. toggle state of multiple todos
   - click on as many circles to remove as many todo

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/todos_toggle.png)

- or click on the arrow on the input left side to toggle all todos

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/todos_toggleAll.png)

### Clear completed

Click the "clear complete" button which shows up on the bottom right corner when at least one todo is completed

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/clear_completed_todos.png)

### Filter

- click "All" button to see all todos (completed or note)

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/seeAll_todos.png)

- click "Active" button to see uncompleted todos

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/seeActive_todos.png)

- click "Completed" button to see completed todos

![todos homepage](/images/tuto/seeCompleted_todos.png)

name: ./manual/benchmarking.md
content:
# Benchmarking The benchmarking will be based on the competitor site **[todolistme.net](http://todolistme.net/)** ## Global application overview ### Features **[todolistme](http://todolistme.net/)** is an todo list app. Its functionalities are as follows: - create, delete, modify a custom list for the todos - switch between your todos lists - add, remove, modify a todo in whichever list - organize todos according to four filter - print todos list - set a due date for tasks - syncing option, to share or synchronise your todos with friends or multiple devices - remote option, to open the todo list in a small new window ### Technology lookup ![Technology lookup](/images/benchmarking/technology_lookup.png) _generate with [Wappalizer](https://www.wappalyzer.com/)_ ## Performance The test performance compare your **[to-do list](https://todos.mokokom.com/)** app and **[todolistme.net](http://todolistme.net/)**. ### Network Performance testing details | title | infos | | -------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | **Navigator** | Google Chrome Version 78.0.3904.70 | | **Parameters** | - incognito mode
- disabled cache
- default online connection
- both site are hosted on a server | | **Tools** | Chrome DevTools
- Network
- Coverage | 1. **[to-do list](https://todos.mokokom.com/)** network performances | | **[to-do list](https://todos.mokokom.com/)** | | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | |
**requests**: 13
**transfered**: 16.1KB
**ressources**: 46.3KB
**finish**: 397ms
**DOMContentLoaded**: 410ms
**loaded**: 409ms | ![Technology lookup](/images/benchmarking/performance/todos_overwall_network.png)
| | Note | Except the one HTTP communication protocol error with onlearn.json, everything seems to work find and load in time.
| | **Improvement** | fix issue onlearn.json file
| 2. **[todolistme.net](http://todolistme.net/)** network performances | | **[todolistme.net](http://todolistme.net/)**
| | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | |
**requests**: 116
**transfered**: 2.5MB
**ressources**: 5.0MB
**finish**: 5.71s
**DOMContentLoaded**: 1.35s
**loaded**: 4.22s | ![Technology lookup](/images/benchmarking/performance/todolistme_overall_network.png)
| | Note 1 |
png files (texture.png load in 1.08s!), ads and jquery-ui.js slow down site's loading. See below:
![loading content todolistme](/images/benchmarking/performance/loading_content_todolistme.png)
| | Note 2 |
coverage tool show that only 95,6% of jQuery and 97.2% of jquery-ui is used
![jQuery coverage](/images/benchmarking/performance/jquery_coverage.png)
| | **Improvements** |
- optimization of png files (ex: replace texture.png background with CSS background or SVG )
- block ads
- ES6 instead of jQuery
- integrated only useful jquery-ui functions
- use cache
| ### Audit Audit details | title | infos | | -------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | **Navigator** | Google Chrome Version 78.0.3904.70 | | **Device** | Desktop | | **Audits** | - Performance
- Progressive web app
- Best practices
- Accessibility
- SEO | | **Throttling** | Applied slow 4G, 4x CPU Slowdown | | | Clear storage | 1. **[to-do list](https://todos.mokokom.com/)** audit | | **[to-do list](https://todos.mokokom.com/)** | Improvements | | ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | **Global score** | ![todos global score](/images/benchmarking/audit/todos_global_score.png) | - Accessibility
- SEO | | **Performance** | ![todos performance](/images/benchmarking/audit/todos_perf.png) | - Preload key requests: add \ to prioritize fetching resources that are currently requested later in page load. | | **Accessibility** | ![todos accessibility](/images/benchmarking/audit/todos_perf.png) | - Form elements do not have associated labels: add type="text" to the input element in index.html | | **Best practices** | ![todos best practices](/images/benchmarking/audit/todos_best_practices.png) | - Browser errors were logged to the console: learn.json, _Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404_ | | **SEO** | ![todos seo](/images/benchmarking/audit/todos_seo.png) | - add \ tag with width or initial-scale
- add meta description
- add description text to link in /docs/index.html | | **Progressive web app** | ![todos progressive web app](/images/benchmarking/audit/todos_pwa.png) | - add service worker to the app to cache files locally and use it offline
- prompt user to install the web app
- configure a custom splash screen | 2. **[todolistme.net](http://todolistme.net/)** audit | | **[to-do list](https://todos.mokokom.com/)** | Improvements | | ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | **Global score** | ![todos global score](/images/benchmarking/audit/tlm_global_score.png) | - Performance
- Accessibility
- Best practices
- SEO
- Progressive web app | | **Performance** | ![todos performance](/images/benchmarking/audit/tlm_perf.png) | - Serve images in next-gen formats
- Eliminate render-blocking resources
- Minify JavaScript
- Remove unused CSS
- Defer offscreen images | | **Accessibility** | ![todos accessibility](/images/benchmarking/audit/tlm_access.png) | - [id] attributes on the page are not unique
- \ elements do not have a title
- Image elements do not have [alt] attributes
- Form elements do not have associated labels
- \ element does not have a [lang] attribute | | **Best practices** | ![todos best practices](/images/benchmarking/audit/tlm_best_pract.png) | - Does not use HTTPS
- Does not use HTTP/2 for all of its resources
- Uses document.write()
- Includes front-end JavaScript libraries with known security vulnerabilities | | **SEO** | ![todos seo](/images/benchmarking/audit/tlm_seo.png) | - Does not have a \ tag with width or initial-scale
- Image elements do not have [alt] attributes | | **Progressive web app** | ![todos progressive web app](/images/benchmarking/audit/todos_pwa.png) | - add service worker to the app to cache files locally and use it offline
- prompt user to install the web app
- configure a custom splash screen | notes comparaison: - security https vs no https - ES6 vs old js - no librairie to load vs jQuery and jQuery UI - not lot of feature vs more features - both app are not fit for PWA
